*div1 type="summary"* *p*W. S. Parrott to Austin, Mexico, January 16, 1833. Mexican politics. Interest in remaining restrictions on immigration into Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*. *date_mentioned n="01-16-1833">Jany 16th 1833*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*S. F Austin Esq*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*My Dear Sir, Your welcome favour of the *date_mentioned n="11-12-1832">12th Nov.*/date_mentioned* came to hand last week, it was no doubt delayed owing to the Suspension and disorder of our mail arrangements; I regret that my time is so much taken up at this moment as to deprive me of the pleasure I would have in replying fully to your interesting letter, but as our correspondence will become more regular in future, I will find leisure to enter upon details. *person_mentioned*Chambers */person_mentioned*I consider has treated me ill not having replied to any of my letters Since he received his books; nor has he paid even to my *person_mentioned*correspondents in *location_mentioned*N. Orleans*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* their value as he promised to do when he gave the order. With the plan of *location_mentioned*zavaleta*/location_mentioned*, hostilities have ceased; but the amalgam I fear will, not give us a permanent peace; all appears to be quiet but not solid; Some of the *location_mentioned*States*/location_mentioned*, will not Subscribe to the plan, others have; *person_mentioned*Genl. Pedraza*/person_mentioned* is however of opinion, that all will go right; my opinion is that the *date_mentioned n="04-04-1833">4th of april next*/date_mentioned* will not pass by without, a noise In relation to the 11th Arto, of the law of the *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">6th of april 1830*/date_mentioned*; there are thousands here who are interested in its repeal Strong remonstrances will therefore be made; and the *person_mentioned*Executive */person_mentioned*is Strongly indisposed against the Said law, and in order to prepare the way for its repeal I will manouvre with the *location_mentioned*liberal presses*/location_mentioned*, and if I have time will translate and have published, Some paragraphs of your letter, as written by a Texano. I Sometimes dabble in politics; but my commercial occupations rarely give me time to think of any thing else but business While you remain in the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, write me and When in the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* I hope to hear from you; I will Send you Some of the most interesting Numbers of the Phoenix. The *location_mentioned*Registro */location_mentioned*is dead; The *person_mentioned*friends of the constitution*/person_mentioned* are trying to revive it.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W. S. Parrott*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*(P. S.) *person_mentioned*Genl Mexia*/person_mentioned* Sends you his remembrance We will work together for the repeal of the law in question. *person_mentioned*Genl. Filasola*/person_mentioned* goes to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*as *person_mentioned*comandant gral*/person_mentioned*. he is interested in the peopling of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*He has a *location_mentioned*grant near the red river*/location_mentioned* abot which we have had several conversations He will go to *location_mentioned*Matamoras */location_mentioned*by land from thence by water to *location_mentioned*Matagorda */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Galveston*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
